alert.note: Alert for Deuel; Keith (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 24 at 9:00AM CDT until further notice by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... South Platte River near Roscoe affecting Deuel and Keith Counties. For the South Platte River...including Roscoe...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...South Platte River near Roscoe. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water reaches the gage house floor. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM MDT Saturday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 AM MDT Saturday was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.4 feet Thursday morning. It will then rise to 10.4 feet Thursday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.5 feet on 06/19/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue South Platte River Roscoe 9.0 9.0 Sat 7 am MDT 9.0 8.6 9.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 800 PM MDT.
